A Place-Timed Petri Net-Based Method to Avoid
Deadlock and Conﬂict in Railway Networks
Jianchao Luo , Mengchu Zhou , Fellow, IEEE, and Jun-Qiang Wang
Abstract— The real-time trafﬁc control of railway networks
imposes safety constraints and authorizes movements of trains.
This work deals with it by focusing on conﬂict and deadlock
avoidance problems. A place-timed Petri net model is developed
for a railway network. Based on it, a conﬂict avoidance method is
presented to ensure that safety principles in railway networks are
respected. Also, a polynomial deadlock avoidance policy based on
the Banker’s algorithm is proposed. It authorizes the movement
of trains between block sections and stations. The proposed
conﬂict avoidance method and deadlock avoidance policy together
ensure a railway network to be conﬂict-free and deadlock-free.
Experimental results show that they are effective and efﬁcient.

Representatively, Wang et al . [49] propose a heuristic search
rescheduling algorithm for conﬂict avoidance of a railway
network based on Petri nets (PNs). The proposed algorithm
resolves conﬂicts by searching a conﬂict-free schedule in the
reachability graph of the PN of a railway network. As the num-
ber of reachable markings of a PN grows exponentially with
the net size, there may be a huge number of unsafe markings
for a large scale deadlock-prone net. Once the rescheduling
algorithm [49] runs into these unsafe markings, it can hardly
jump out of them, causing its failure to ﬁnd a schedule in
a reasonable time. Since deadlock avoidance or prevention
policies can avoid unsafe markings, the rescheduling algo-
rithm [49] can be extended for large scale deadlock-prone nets
by integrating with such policies.

VI. C ONCLUSION
This work focuses on the conﬂict and deadlock avoidance
of railway networks with ﬂexible routes. To characterize
such networks, a new class of place-timed Petri net called
RNPN is deﬁned. Based on it, a conﬂict avoidance method
whose complexity is O(1) is proposed. Also, a polynomial
deadlock avoidance policy based on the Banker’s Algorithm is
proposed for the ﬁrst time for such networks. The conﬂict
avoidance method together with DAP makes a railway net-
work conﬂict/deadlock-free. To test its permissiveness and
runtime, small and large railway networks are constructed.
